Sentencas: Proton-conducting solid-oxide electrolyzer and fuel cells (PC-SOECs/FCs) represent viable, intermediate-temperature green technologies for H-2 production and conversion.
Titulo: Computational design of cobalt-free mixed proton-electron conductors for solid oxide electrochemical cells

Sentencas: While PC ceramics have been extensively investigated as electrolytes for PC-SOECs/
Titulo: Computational design of cobalt-free mixed proton-electron conductors for solid oxide electrochemical cells

Sentencas: FCs, the development of corresponding singlephase electrode components has been hindered by difficulties in finding efficient mixed proton-electron conductors (MPECs), with also effective catalytic activity toward oxygen reduction and evolution reactions (ORR/OER).
Titulo: Computational design of cobalt-free mixed proton-electron conductors for solid oxide electrochemical cells

Sentencas: To address this challenge, we applied first-principles methods (PBE+U) to design new perovskite-oxide MPEC electrodes based on the known BaZrO3 PC ceramic.
Titulo: Computational design of cobalt-free mixed proton-electron conductors for solid oxide electrochemical cells

Sentencas: Our strategy has been to modify the parent material by substituting Zr with earth abundant transition metals, namely Mn and Fe.
Titulo: Computational design of cobalt-free mixed proton-electron conductors for solid oxide electrochemical cells

Sentencas: We found Zr : Mn and Zr : Fe ratios of 0.75 : 0.25 to be sufficient to obtain electronic structural features that can enable electric conductivity.
Titulo: Computational design of cobalt-free mixed proton-electron conductors for solid oxide electrochemical cells

Sentencas: We also investigated other relevant processes for MPEC-based electrodes: hydration, proton migration, and ORR/OER electrocatalysis.
Titulo: Computational design of cobalt-free mixed proton-electron conductors for solid oxide electrochemical cells

Sentencas: From calculations of key descriptors associated with these processes, we found that Zr substitution with Mn or Fe delivers in both cases promising PC-SOEC/FC electrodes.
Titulo: Computational design of cobalt-free mixed proton-electron conductors for solid oxide electrochemical cells

Sentencas: Moreover, our first-principles results highlight the specific qualities of Mn and Fe: the first provides better electronic features and electrocatalytic activities, whereas the latter allows for better hydration and proton migration.
Titulo: Computational design of cobalt-free mixed proton-electron conductors for solid oxide electrochemical cells

Sentencas: In perspective, our findings present clear indications for the experimental implementation and test of new low-cost materials for solid-oxide electrochemical cells.
Titulo: Computational design of cobalt-free mixed proton-electron conductors for solid oxide electrochemical cells
